derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: from Latin intersect- 'cut, intersected', from the verb intersecare, from inter- 'between' + secare 'to cut'

entry.def: If two or more lines or roads intersect, they meet or cross each other. You can also say that one line or road intersects another.

example.ex: The orbit of this comet intersects the orbit of the Earth...
example.tran: 这颗彗星的轨道与地球的轨道交叉。

example.ex: The circles will intersect in two places...
example.tran: 这两个圆将在两处交叉。

entry.def: If one thing intersects with another or if two things intersect, the two things have a connection at a particular point.

example.ex: ...the ways in which historical events intersect with individual lives...
example.tran: 历史事件与个人生活发生关联的方式

entry.def: If a place, area, or surface is intersected by things such as roads or lines, they cross it.

example.ex: The city is intersected by three main waterways.
example.tran: 该城市由 3 条主要水路贯穿。

stems_affixes.word_buile: inter在……之间,相互+changeable可改变的→adj.可互换的
inter在…之间+n+al表形容词→adj.内在的, 国内的
inter在……之间,相互+national国家的→adj.国际的
inter在……之间,相互+personal个人的→adj.人与人之间的
inter在……之间,相互+action行动→相互行动→影响
inter在……之间,相互+lud玩+e→在中间玩→活动间休息
inter在……之间,相互+relate关连→n.相互关连
inter在……之间,相互+v+al表形容词→n.间隔, 距离
inter在……之间,相互+pose放→放在二者之间
inter在……之间,相互+sect切割→在中间切→横断
inter在……之间,相互+sperse散开→v.散布,点缀
inter在……之间,相互+ven走+e→走在二者之间→干涉
sect切,割+arian……的,有人的意思→把人群分开的→搞宗派的
section[[n.章节,部分;地区,部门,科;截面,剖面]]糠?al……的→adj.可组合的
dissect[v.解剖;详细研究]+ion表名词→n.解剖,切开
in进入+sect切,割→昆虫一节一节如被切开

dis分开+sect切,割→分开切
